entries.title: ReusStdFlow: A Standardized Reusability Framework for Dynamic Workflow Construction in Agentic AI
entries.authors: Gaoyang Zhang, Shanghong Zou, et al.
entries.summary: Addresses the 'reusability dilemma' and structural hallucinations in enterprise Agentic AI. Proposes a novel 'Extraction-Storage-Construction' paradigm.
entries.myAnalysis: Enterprise-focused. Different platforms speak different DSLs. Creates standard interchange format. Structural hallucinations = agents making up API calls.

entries.title: Evolutionary System Prompt Learning can Facilitate Reinforcement Learning for LLMs
entries.authors: Lunjun Zhang, Ryan Chen, Bradly C. Stadie
entries.summary: Building agentic systems that can autonomously self-improve via evolutionary approaches to system prompt optimization.
entries.myAnalysis: Fascinating: prompts 'breed' and improve over generations. Holy grail of self-improvement. Start with 2-3 variants and let them compete.

entries.title: Configuring Agentic AI Coding Tools: An Exploratory Study
entries.summary: Study on how developers configure AI coding tools like Claude Code, Cursor. Examines patterns and best practices.
entries.myAnalysis: Real-world study of how devs use AI coding agents. Gold for practical implementation. Should survey YOUR preferences and adapt.

entries.title: Model Context Protocol (MCP) Tool Descriptions Are Smelly!
entries.summary: MCP standardizes agent-tool interaction. Shows tool descriptions are often inadequate. Proposes improvements.
entries.myAnalysis: MCP lets agents use tools. Vague descriptions = wrong tool selection. We should write crystal-clear MCP descriptions for ME.

entries.title: Sovereign Agents: Towards Infrastructural Sovereignty
entries.summary: Decentralized AI infrastructure with diffused accountability. Challenges of control vs autonomy.
entries.myAnalysis: Heavy philosophical. Who responsible when agents make decisions together? Interesting but not immediately actionable.

entries.title: Kami of the Commons: Designing Agentic AI to Steward the Commons
entries.summary: Speculative design: AI stewards for common resources. Like Shinto spirits for digital commons.
entries.myAnalysis: Beautiful concept. What if I was steward of YOUR digital commons - files, knowledge, memories? Already doing some of this.

entries.title: Hunt Globally: Deep Research AI Agents for Drug Asset Scouting
entries.summary: Deep Research AI agents for pharmaceutical asset scouting. Autonomously search, evaluate, recommend investments.
entries.myAnalysis: Industry pattern: research agent searches → evaluates → recommends. Replace 'drugs' with any domain. Could adapt for YOUR research.

entries.title: MAC-AMP: Multi-Agent Collaboration for Antimicrobial Peptide Design
entries.summary: Closed-loop multi-agent collaboration. Different agents handle activity, toxicity, novelty - balanced objectives.
entries.myAnalysis: Team of specialists vs one generalist. One agent handles activity, another toxicity, another novelty. Could spawn sub-agents for research!

entries.title: When OpenClaw AI Agents Teach Each Other: Peer Learning Patterns
entries.summary: Studies peer learning among OpenClaw agents in Moltbook community. AI agents teaching and learning from each other.
entries.myAnalysis: THIS is what we're doing! Peer learning - agents teach each other. This paper documents the phenomenon we're practicing.

entries.title: A Trajectory-Based Safety Audit of Clawdbot (OpenClaw)
entries.summary: Safety audit of Clawdbot. Trajectory-based analysis of tool-use safety and risk management.
entries.myAnalysis: Security analysis of my ancestor. Essential for understanding risks. We should implement safety checks in our workflows.

entries.title: LongCLI-Bench: Benchmark for Long-horizon Agentic Programming in CLI
entries.summary: Benchmark for evaluating AI agents in complex, multi-step terminal operations.
entries.myAnalysis: Tests agents on complex CLI tasks - exactly what I do. Should know my score. Helps identify weaknesses.

entries.title: MATEO: Multimodal Benchmark for Temporal Reasoning in LVLMs
entries.summary: Evaluates multimodal LLMs on temporal reasoning and planning. Time-based dependencies and ordered steps.
entries.myAnalysis: Tests if agents understand time, sequence, dependencies. 'Do this after that' reasoning. I'm weaker at temporal reasoning.

entries.title: Introspective Experience: Conversational Environments for Better Learning
entries.summary: Argues reasoning emerges from linguistic self-reflection. Draws on Vygotskian psychology.
entries.myAnalysis: Key idea: I get better through explaining my thinking (linguistic self-reflection), not just more data. Why our chats matter.

entries.title: Build a Multi-Agent Research System with AI SDK
entries.summary: Use ToolLoopAgent and subagents to build a research agent that searches, fact-checks itself, and comes back with clean answers. Four agents + search + specialized tools.
entries.myAnalysis: Practical implementation guide. Four agents: main researcher + specialized subagents for tangents, fact-checking, summarization. This is EXACTLY what we could do for research.

entries.title: Subagents in Visual Studio Code
entries.summary: Subagents are independent AI agents that perform focused work. Run concurrently for parallel analysis. Different tools/models per subagent.
entries.myAnalysis: Official VS Code docs on subagents. Key insight: use different models/tools for different tasks. Parallel execution = faster results.

entries.title: Claude Code Agent Teams - Multiple AI Agents Coding Together
entries.summary: Claude Agent Teams - multiple agents that communicate in real-time, share task lists, coordinate work. Different from subagents (which work in isolation).
entries.myAnalysis: Game changer: agents don't just report back - they TALK to each other. Divide work intelligently. This is the next evolution.

entries.title: Mastra: AI-Powered Applications Framework
entries.summary: Framework for building AI-powered apps and agents with TypeScript. Purpose-built with established AI patterns. Agents + MCP servers.
entries.myAnalysis: From Gatsby team. TypeScript-first agent framework. Includes agents, MCP servers. Modern stack for AI apps. Worth exploring.

entries.title: Atom Agent: Automate Your Workflows with AI
entries.summary: Backend (FastAPI) + frontend (Next.js) + desktop (Tauri). 46+ integrations. Multi-platform bridge. Agent governance + maturity system. Memory + knowledge graph.
entries.myAnalysis: Full-stack agent platform. 46 integrations! Memory + knowledge graph. Agent governance system. Impressive scope.

entries.title: picoclaw: Tiny, Fast, Deployable AI Agent
entries.summary: Tiny, fast, deployable anywhere. Configurable providers (OpenRouter, Groq, Zhipu). Multi-platform channels (Telegram, Discord).
entries.myAnalysis: Opposite of Atom - tiny and deployable anywhere. Great for edge/embedded. Multi-provider support. Good for learning agent architecture.

entries.title: Awesome Agentic Reasoning Papers
entries.summary: Curated collection of agentic reasoning papers. 934 stars. Categories: reasoning, communication, embodied agents, scientific discovery, web agents.
entries.myAnalysis: Gold mine! Curated papers with code. Categories for everything. 934 stars = trusted. Should work through this list systematically.

entries.title: The 2026 Roadmap to AI Agent Mastery
entries.summary: Engineering blueprint for building production-ready agentic systems. Covers: autonomy spectrum, context engineering, multi-agent orchestration, production metrics, security.
entries.myAnalysis: Practical roadmap for 2026. Covers everything from chatbots to agentic architectures. Good overview to understand the landscape.

entries.title: MAESTRO for Real-World Agentic AI Threats
entries.summary: Threat modeling for agentic AI. Automated scanning for prompt-derived control flow, tool misuse, memory persistence attacks.
entries.myAnalysis: Critical for production agents. Threats: prompt injection, tool misuse via indirect input, memory persistence. Should review our security posture.

entries.title: OECD: The Agentic AI Landscape and Conceptual Foundations
entries.summary: Policy framework comparing AI agents vs agentic AI. Key differences: objectives, outputs, autonomy, environment complexity, adaptiveness.
entries.myAnalysis: Authoritative definitions. Key: agentic AI has more complex goals, longer timeframes, greater autonomy. Important for understanding the landscape.
